informative-signs.title: Motorway
informative-signs.desc: Speed limit is 80 km/h unless another limit is set, which it normally is. 110 km/h is the highest limit found, and is set on the highest standard motorways. Lower limits may be set on lower standard or busier roads.

informative-signs.title: Motor traffic road
informative-signs.desc: Speed limit is 80 km/h unless another limit is specifically set. Some are signposted to 90 km/h.

informative-signs.title: Heavy traffic lane
informative-signs.desc: Only vehicles with allowed total weight higher than indicated can use this lane.

informative-signs.title: Car-pool lane
informative-signs.desc: Only vehicles with more than indicated occupants including driver can use this lane. Buses and taxis, regardless of how many occupants can also use this lane.[b]

informative-signs.title: End of bus and taxi lane
Passing place
informative-signs.desc: Used frequently on long stretches of single-track roads. Parking forbidden.

informative-signs.title: Dead end
informative-signs.desc: Road physically closed

informative-signs.title: Dead end
informative-signs.desc: Side-road physically closed

informative-signs.title: Dead end
informative-signs.desc: Road closed for vehicles

informative-signs.title: Dead end
informative-signs.desc: Side-road closed for vehicles

informative-signs.title: Merging lanes
informative-signs.desc: Merging by the “zipper method”.

informative-signs.title: Merging roads with speed regulation lane
informative-signs.desc: Oncoming lane has to adapt. Merging by the “zipper method”.

informative-signs.title: Merging roads with speed regulation lane
informative-signs.desc: This lane has to adapt. Merging by the “zipper method”.

informative-signs.title: End of lane
informative-signs.desc: The ending lane has to give way.

informative-signs.title: Lane division
informative-signs.desc: Denotes the number of lanes and what direction they go.

informative-signs.title: Changed driving pattern
informative-signs.desc: May be used in conjunction with road works.

informative-signs.title: Living street
informative-signs.desc: The speed limit is "walking speed."

informative-signs.title: Pedestrian zone
informative-signs.desc: Motor vehicles are normally prohibited in pedestrian zone. If exemption is granted by a supplementary sign, the speed limit is "walking speed."

informative-signs.title: Emergency layby
informative-signs.desc: To be used only in case of vehicle breakdown or other emergency.

informative-signs.title: Speed limit enforced by automatic camera
Speed limit enforced by automatic camera - average speed measurement
informative-signs.desc: A flashing yellow indicator is also placed at the end of speed measurement zone. This will flash if the vehicle's measured average speed exceeded the speed limit.

informative-signs.title: Information board
informative-signs.desc: Alternative: 1Sign 560 may provide information about miscellaneous traffic conditions. May have a brown background if the information is specifically aimed at tourists. Must have a yellow background if it's a temporary sign, or an orange background if it provides information about detours.

informative-signs.title: General speed limits
informative-signs.desc: Information board posted on border crossings on Norwegian national roads, Norwegian county roads and ferry terminals.

informative-signs.title: Pedestrians and cyclist prohibited
informative-signs.desc: On motorways and motor traffic roads

informative-signs.title: Emergency exit
informative-signs.desc: For tunnels.

informative-signs.title: Direction and distance to emergency exit
informative-signs.desc: For tunnels.
